communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

bodycam footages for Johnson Family (4 members)
incident date 23 july 2023

arrest date 27 -28 july 2023

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Martin Brooks.

title: Russell John Flint, Jr. Pardon Details - NARA

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Russell John Flint, Jr. Pardon Details - NARA
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A digital copy of the Indictment and the Judgment and Commitment Order for the following historical criminal case:

Defendant: Russell John Flint, Jr.
Case Number: 66-CR-216
Court: U.S. District Court for the Northern District of Illinois
Sentence Date: June 30, 1966

Specific Information Sought: I am seeking the names of the specific individuals for whom the defendant was charged with aiding and abetting the making of false Selective Service Registration Certificates.

This record is over 50 years old and is of significant historical and journalistic interest following the subject's presidential pardon on January 15, 2026. Please advise on the reproduction fees.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anna Massoglia
